::: {.cell}

:::


::: {.cell}

:::

This page provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**S1.1 Aerobic caves**](/efg-info/S1_1.qmd). For older or alternative maps, see [here](/altmap-info/S1_1_history.qmd).

## Methods

Here is the methods summary for **Map code and version**: S1.1.web.orig v1.0.

> Distributions of Aerobic caves were based on mapped area of carbonate rock outcrop (Williams & Ting Fong 2016). This. provides an upper limit on the area of exposed karst terrain, as not all carbonate rocks are karstified. Lava tubes and other rocks that may contain these ecosystem functional groups are not shown on this indicative map, but are less extensive than those in carbonate rock.

::: {.cell}

:::



::: {.cell}

:::



### Datasets

**Carbonate-rocks-3.0** (Williams P, Ting Fong Y  2016):

Source of _topography and geomorphology_.
 Resolution: variable (polygons), static.
 Accuracy evaluation: qualitative (experts judgement).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset             |url                                                                  |
|:-------------------|:--------------------------------------------------------------------|
|Carbonate-rocks-3.0 |<https://www.fos.auckland.ac.nz/our_research/karst/>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Processing

Processing steps used in this map are: *Selection*.

### Map evaluation


This map is considered to be a ***Coarse quality map*** based on the following characteristics:

Concept alignment is *Indirect,general*.

Ground observations are _no_.

 The accuracy evaluation *Qualitative expert assessment,undocumented*.

## How to use the data

### Available files

:::{.aside}

Following maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group. `Web navigation` maps are optimised for use in webapps, but they have similar methods and differ only in details of format and processing. 

- Indicative Map (**code: S1.1.IM.orig**, version v1.0) 
 - Web navigation (**code: S1.1.web.orig**, version v1.0) 


:::

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

**S1.1.IM.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/S1.1.IM.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3958934){target="gisdata"}

**S1.1.web.orig** (v1.0): [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/S1.1.web.orig_v1.0.tif){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419){target="gisdata"} :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091117){target="gisdata"} :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.S1_1_web_orig){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](layers/S1.1.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"} :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/){target="gisdata"} :: [GitHub repository](S1.1.web.orig_v1.0_topo.json){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
